reviews: Very beautiful, must visit. Workers are very friendly and attentive.Our butlers were AB and Hector and they did a great job on making sure our needs were met and that we were having a great time. They speak Spanish and English so that was very helpful.

This property is very intimate which provides for exceptional service and a great time. Because the property isn't big, you truly get to know the staff and it makes the experience much better. There's personalized service throughout, staff is really friendly, and there's nice activities on and off property. Highly recommend!

Horrible experience. We were invited to the hotel by the Legendary Vacation Club company. Please take my advice into consideration and do not get scammed. It was a huge waist of our time, at the end they offered us a day pass as a “gift certificate” which I am being charged for now. They also offered 2 all inclusive tour experience as an incentive to go hear their offers which at the end we would have to pay expensive transportation if we accepted so we just ended up wasting a full day of our vacation time :( The resort was deficient in many ways. If you want to experience this beautiful part of Mexico look for a better option worthy of your money.

This is my husband and I’s second trip to HR Cancun- last one being in 2018. We truly loved it both times though there were some notable changes, as to be expected after 5 years. The food was very good- the romantic dinner by the beach was gorgeous. We spent majority of our time at the pool and had the best service from Principe- he was AMAZING and made you feel like you were the most important person in the pool even though he was serving well over 20 people at a time. We did miss the taco bar that used to be by the pool but the burgers and pizza held us over until dinner. Maintenance was being done at the time but honestly we didn’t notice the noise much as we were just focused on enjoying ourselves. Our ONLY major complaint is the pushy sales to become Legendary members which

One of the great resort in Cancun, the crew is very helpful and kind. Also very clean place to stay, with great restaurants and bars. Goretti was really nice the whole time. Thanks for the great place.

The first time staying at Hard Rock, the first time in Mexico was a great experience. The staff, food, room, listening to ocean in the morning, great experience! I have told my friends and family to stay here. I will be back!

I really wanted to give this resort a five-star review but two areas of the experience frustrated me. Check in and check out are not efficient processes and take quite a bit of time to complete. Also the upselling of the resort both at check-in and check out, I do not enjoy.  The hotel itself is older, but if you can get past the aesthetic, it's a wonderful place to stay. The staff there is super accommodating, super friendly and are a great time to interact with. The food is quite good with my favorite restaurant being Toro with a very close second being zenn.  Every night the wait stuff of all the establishments were accommodating and quick with refills or any accommodation.  The hotel room itself is dated but they are doing renovations.  Our room was with an ocean view. The

For the price they charge this resort is not worth it. Food is very average. Pool and room need updates and maintenance. Broken tiles all over the pool - cutting hazards.   Staff is the only saving grace. They are very helpful and positive overall. However until the resort resolves it’s maintenance and food quality issues - save your money and go elsewhere.

Where do I even begin with this review  After paying well over $4000 for two for 6 nights we were left beyond disappointed with not only the state of the resort but the staff treatment as well, if we count the whole group as a whole, the money spent was close to $13,000.  Hard Rock bases their guests attendance ON MEMBERSHIPS, hence you’ll see wristbands of different colors everywhere, this is for the staff to identify who deserves a better service despite how much people has paid for their vacation, and all this is a problem that corporation is very well aware of, I’ll explain soon.   The resort needs to close down for a while and be completely renovated, hallway ceilings are moldy, leaky and swelled up to the point it’s cracking, soon they will start falling apart, not to

I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from 9th - 12th May 2023 during a business trip. The surroundings were always spotless, the staff super friendly and the live nightly entertainment was top notch.   While the restaurants did lack variety in my opinion, overall my stay was comfortable and I would definitely recommend to family and friends.

Very disappointed  with this hotel , first time staying at hard rock , the hotel is very outdated , and lacks spaces for entertainment. The lobby/bar looks like an office space,  full of desks and no place to entertain or dance , been too many hotels all inclusive and regular ones and I feetl like my money wasn't worth it at all , unless you have or pay for the "forced " membership they don't Even notice you are here and treat you like a 3rd class guest.  I  came to Mexico expecting to feel like I was in Mexico but it wasn't the case at all , the only Mexican "experiences " were limited for the vip/members only at the terrace. The hot tubs in the rooms were  extremely dirty with mold coming out of the jets.  The staff at the restaurants were very attentive and nice, on the other

Wonderful experience. I was enjoying of all the amenities and decided to take a dip in the beach before getting ready for dinner. Like many things that happen in the unexpected ocean I felt a sharp pain in my arm. Something seemed to bite me and the second I came out of the water and rushed to my daughter the team of life guards came and attended to me. Helped ease my nerves and cleaned and attended to my wounds properly. The main lifeguard was Sarahi Matadamas she wouldn't leave my side till she knew I was feeling better and informed me of all the next steps. I'm not sure of the names of the rest of the team but multiple people rushed over and gave me everything I could need. My biggest thank yous to them

Stayed at the Hard Rock Cancun for the long weekend with my fiancé.  I’ve been to other HRHs but first time in Cancun.  It was amazing!  Service was outstanding, great quality top shelf drinks, the view is incredible.    The pool concierge team (Tacho, Angel & Edwin) went out of their way to get us premier pool chairs and umbrella each day.  Awesome service and always could count on them.  Our server at Ciao, Carlos, was one of the best we’ve had.  His Mexican coffee at the end was delicious!  The entertainment staff was incredible, and all of them were great.  Big thank you to Christian for helping us find a song we wanted to use for our wedding intro- we appreciate that so much!   Great crowd, great views, hamburgers are the best.  Definitely worth it even if we only had 3

Hard Rock Cancun we were there in May of 2023 our trip was wonderful the weather was great food was good our room was very clean not complaints we love traveling there it is a smaller hotel but it does not lack service.

Travelled to HRC June 4-11, return trip, 18 total in our group. Check in easy. Pool warm   Excellent towel service (Seki) and the best cheeseburgers (not Kidding)cooked by Linette at the pool. Now it’s Saturday night and No Buffet.  So good luck getting a table at the sit downs.  Generally noisy place with one of 2 swim up bars closed. Security good but had a drunk trying to enter our room one midnight  They need to rehab the pool tiles and put AC in the Asian restaurant. Very hard working staff but the up selling is extreme  Maybe a Riu or an Iberostar for me next trip to Mexico

Hard Rock must translate to classless guests in Spanish.  As a result, they are very heavy-handed with security. The customer service is horrible. The building is old. The umbrellas are rusty. The beds are stained. They constantly try to corral you into their "members club" scam sales presentation. They don't take no for an answer and the sales people are pushy. You wait in line for everything. Your whole vacation is wasted waiting in line or being harassed by security or being chased by sales people. My wife and I have been to Cancun many times over the years and I have to say this is the worst experience we've had there and we won't be returning to this hotel. Oh, and the grinding tile saw was a nice touch on the beach all day.

Our Butler’s Rafa and Rorro did a great job making sure we were comfortable. They made dinner reservations and reserved pool chairs each day., they were there for everything we wanted and went to extreme to take very good care of our family. If visiting the Cancun Hard Rock again we would definitely request to have them!

Hard Rock Cancun was amazing! The entertainment staff did an excellent job of engaging people in activities and creating a fun experience! The food was great and there was always someone checking in to make sure you had all you need!  However, what truly made our trip extra special was Neto and Gerkyl! They were hands down the two key individuals that allowed for our family to focus on relaxing, having fun and being together. The private dinner was such a wonderful way to close out our vacation and the view was one of the best. Thank you Neto and Gerkyl for being so kind, attentive and proactive with ensuring all things went smoothly! What a blessing being able to get us all together in such a beautiful place!

Do your research..... There are much nicer resorts in Cancun area. For what they charge this should be at least a 5 star resort... I would rate it a 2 star. Old, run down, pool is lame, no happy fun vibe what so ever, one swim up bar is closed for renovations, thats all you hear all day long is saws and equip. Food is OK. restaurant hours are horrible, breakfast is horrible they are all buffets in morning. They claim to be a top resort for kids and teenagers. Hardly any kids there. Reason being, there is nothing for kids or teens to do. The Timeshare sales staff is extremely pushy even though they claim they are not. Called our room at least twice a day trying to sell their timeshare pkg. Then would stalk you around the resort trying to book you in for their sales pitch.. We

From the moment, my roommate and I entered the room we were a bit disappointed. We paid extra for ocean view however our room had a big building blocking part of the ocean. Then, upon sitting on the bed I found a blonde string of hair (neither of our dark hair) and smudges on one of my pillows. On the second day, our room wasn’t cleaned and when asked the housekeeper was rude and proceeded to hang up on us. Lastly, when attempting to set up transportation to return home we were promptly told the concierge could help us. Then ignored by the concierge while she typed on the computer for at least 20 mins. Only when I complained to my friend about the lack of service and review I would be writing did the staff member decide to assist us. Even if you’re not looking for a “luxury”

Great service and delicious food at all restaurants. Hotel is at a great location..  service throughout the hotel has been amazing.  Rooms could use renovation.  Entertainment has been wonderful and very enjoyable.   All areas throughout the hotel have been very clean.

everything was great from the moment I arrived until my exit, the spa was absolutely magnificent, The food in each dining area was delish. the entertainment was flawless especially Studio 54 and the Michael Jackson review. the Reggae band was awesome. In spite of the rain it was an excellent vacation,

The beds are super comfy and the pillows are the best! All the staff are lovely especially Goretti - she does the entertainment and is so lovely and always happy to help.  Would definitely recommend this hotel

The service at Hard Rock Cancun was amazing! Everyone was very friendly and attentive.   We had an amazing week. The building and grounds were immaculate. We loved the staff at the Smash Bar.  The bartenders were great!!

I was really annoyed the check in was so slow waiting for more than 15 minutes after long flights is not great. Room was nice but surprisingly dated for a relatively new hotel.  Very difficult to keep the suite at the right temperature.

Got to say pretty underwhelmed after paying over 5k for 2 weeks.  Firstly staff,location,food and beach all superb.   Entertainment decent but bar options very poor ( there is no options only one lobby bar )    Trying to be fair I would imagine if you come for a short trip this would be sufficient but for 14 days it becomes monotonous especially as the entertainment staff never use 10 words where 100 will do and shout even though they have the use of a microohone.  Our biggest issue is the members tiers that Tui fail to warn you about and the reserving of every pool side bed for such members.   Don't get me wrong there's always beds available but it would be nice to get a front row bed near the pool bar but they all have owners nameplates on them from about 7am and towel station

The front desk of the Hard Rock has no idea what they are doing. They never answer their calls before  you check in to make any accommodations prior to your arrival they just transfer you from department to department and none answer. Upon arrival everyone only the bell man are nice, other staff and managers don't treat guests with hospitality. We never received the 1 bedroom room requested and to top it off were placed in a room with a view to the a/c unit. They did nothing to make our stay welcome in the 4 days we stayed there. The food in the buffet is reused daily no variety. If you are not purchasing one of their timeshare properties with Hard Rock you get treated like a regular guest not VIP.

We stayed 8 days and had an amazing time there, food is really good, rooms and all areas are very clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There is also a lot of activities in the pool, bars and theatre everyday

Food and amenities were great the customer service was outstanding. The only concerns the anniversary package that was approved with my online purchase was not added to our room and the extras that come with it. Other than that the best customer service and a beautiful hotel to stay. Would highly recommend.

We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel  for our 24th wedding anniversary. Hotel and rooms were always clean, great service and staff was friendly. Room service was always fast.  Mixed drinks were delicious. Food was good, my favorite restaurant was Ciao- never disappointed. On our 3rd night, the hotel surprised us by delivering a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries to our room for our anniversary. Only downside was that walls were paper thin, I could hear people in other rooms talking. Overall we had a great experience, will definitely be staying there again.

Just finished a great week at the hard rock Cancun. We enjoyed the infinity pool overlooking the ocean how easy it was to access activities and restaurants. Jessy and Alexis were great and helped us feel welcome with special treats in the room and chairs on the beach. One of the most memorable things from our week was a room service dinner on the balcony  with Chac and watching sea turtles while we ate.

Let’s start with the best part of it the butler Jessie is amazing I wish she had better tools at this facility. Place is in serious need of updates and better food and Drinks. A/C is horrible in all areas except in the entrance. It’s a small resort family resort very busy. The pools all need updates our friend cut her foot.

Special note on the customer service given throughout our whole stay at this hotel. The kindness and going the extra mile by all the staff at this hotel is incredible. Our favorite restaurant was Frida and most favorite waiters at this one particular location were Iván and Carlos. Not only they they were happy to serve us but went beyond in giving us suggestions and advice on all sorts of information regarding food and drinks. Our room was located on the 10th floor and the views were spectacular as well as very clean and comfortable. We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with families and friends who are looking to be in one of the best spots in the hotel area in Cancun.

Staff at HRH Cancun is super positive and professional. Concierge services are really professional, Fernando and Karen are doing an extremely well job, very professional, always with a great smile and attitude, always willing to help and very knowledgeable. Lorena and Giorgio in the Rock Shop are the best, their smile and professionalism made me come back to the shop and want to spend time there more. Gustaf (Gus) from Entertainment team at the pool is incredibly positive attitude, making people feel they have their best vacation. They work very hard for the customers, and honestly, they are the ones who made a difference in my vacation and me thinking to come back. HRH Cancun is lucky to have these guys on these teams. Thank you.

1st thing you walk into, you get the vibe really easily.  I liked how the lobby was set-up as well as the music in the lobby.  Rooms are cleaned out before every guest that gets their rooms. Beds are so comfortable here and really relaxing. Food Restaurants have a good quality in their food. Everything tasted better than the other hotels I personally went to.  Staff here is very friendly. The pool staff Regina and Gustavo are the better staff members there. They are always so lively and energetic and want people to join their activities which is fun. I personally always do the activities those 2 always do.

Would not go bad. Choose another hotel so many better ones out there. All they wanna do is sale you packages. Do not go there. It is a very old hotel, needs a lot of updating. Piles are falling off the pole everywhere.

This place is not a great place. The Presidential suites are not Presidential suites they are two rooms with door in the middle. Both rooms leaked water one was fix during our stay but leaked again. The staff id great but the service was poor. Im a legendary member and i will not return to the hotel in Cancun. Needs updating its a motel 6 at best.

The food was not good at the restaurants we ate at. Being in Cancun I would expect to be able to get some good Mexican food by the main pool. We had to go to the VIP pool on the 3rd floor to be able to get some tacos, which were not good. The drinks were below average and the beer was warm when first given to me at the pool bar. I was hoping that it was going to be a good experience, but was disappointed overall. The best thing about the hotel was its proximity to great restaurants outside the resort. We went out to eat 3 of the 5 nights because the hotel food options were not good. At Ciao, the short rib was impossible to cut (good short rib shouldn't even require a knife) and it was tough to chew. At Zen the food was soggy and didn't have flavor. I heard from other guests that

The food is the same at all the restaurants, not much of a selection.  The all inclusive is only for what they deem is worth serving.  Even if you have a bracelet that is premium or royalty, the amenities are the same.  For the price and name -- NOT WORTH IT.

This is a great resort to go to- we will be back! I especially liked the dining and room service, I recommend early morning fruit and bread basket. We made way too many trips to the bakery. No complaints. I would watch the salespeople in the convenience store shop- they charged me for a bag I didn’t want without asking me.

The hotel facilities are incredible, the service and attention from the staff is excellent. The activities are fun, although they could be more dynamic, but was cool.What a good, fast and efficient service from them. I'll back soon.

As soon as you enter and check in, the time share people will act as if they are your guide around the resort.  They are truly trying to get you to schedule a breakfast to try and sell you a timeshare.  Read the BBB reviews on Legendary Vacations before you go to any please.  I walked out, didn’t provide a credit card, and paid for my own messages.  I just think it is crazy to have that a 4.5 star hotel.   Otherwise, service was good.  Food was overall good.  Drinks were good.  The resort is more of a party resort, I would take my kids.  This trip was just me and my wife, so not a problem.  Also, a lot of the pictures are for the hall of fame members, not normal guest.  There are several blocked off areas if you do not have the correct wrist bands.

This is a small resort but everything and everyone make you feel fantastic. From the wonderful staff to the food and shows, we have no complaints…. You will have a great time. People went above and beyond to make our stay so pleasant. The entertainment staff do so much and will keep you busy all day long!

The hard rock hotel is beautiful but what really made our stay was the service. AB, Hector, and the rest of the team provided service beyond anything I’d ever experienced or expected. I’d literally come back just to see them. They were so attentive and anticipated our needs. They also planned special events for us that were such a special extra touch. AB, you’re the man!

The people!! The persons who work at the resort are the ones that made this trip so memorable and probably one of the best of all the HR Resorts that we have stayed, including the humongous Punta Cana; staff from Restaurant Zen, managers (Pasillas), hostesses (Jacqueline, Claudia), waiters (Luis, Isaac, Carlos, Alexis) incredible service, very professional, polite, excellent service to detail) the lady cooking the tamales, sopes, tacos, gordita’s, etc; the cocktail waiter at the pool (Xampala, tremendous person and waiter, excelente; bartenders at the pool (Escobar, Li and there was a third who’s name I forgot but always took excellent care of me); the entertainment was excellent, incredible, without them this would had been a disaster, a special thanks to all of them, they made

My husband and I love Cancun, and we live music. Hard Rock has fantastic service, entertainment, and food. I have food allergies and can eat safely here. A wonderful trip for everyone- there’s always something to do!

I want to preface this as a legendary member with HR for the last 6 years. I have been to approximately 20 resorts to Mexico in the last 7-8 years. This is by far the worst resort I have ever been to. I have actually cancelled my membership during this trip.  Everything here is a scam from the time you enter the property. Upon checking in the legendary concierge told us since we’re such great members our room was being upgraded to top level. Because we checked in before 3 pm we had to go back to the front desk to retrieve room keys after 3. When we went back at 3 I was given a standard room which was ok with us, but when I asked about top level I was told it would cost 250.00 more. I guess my pause wasn’t welcomed and was then told we could have top level free of charge. We were

Overall I would recommend this resort, especially for families with small children. I say small children or anyone over 18. We had 2 families with kids aged 8, 14, 17, 18 and 19. I would say the 17 year old was the one that had the least fun. There are kids clubs for the littler ones and a night club for the 18+ kids. The 14 and 17 year old felt there was just not much to do.         The waterpark was nice, but it looks bigger online. All the kids enjoyed it for about 1 hour. But once you ride the big slides a few times it got boring for them. The extra amenities that cost were bowling, the Escape Game and the game room. We only took part in the bowling which was fun. They have mini bowling and regular bowling. We did the mini bowling and it was only $10/person for 1 hour.

Junk status,I never go into this Hotel,Hotel staff only provide service to member and all other non member service is junk and ignore them,Food has long waiting time,Asian resturant main front desk guy is rude and his face expression looks like he hate us when we go for lunch and dinner Totally garbage guy. Totally non professional and Lots flying bugs flying on salad bar area Most Lobby staff has only interest in selling Membership and push and rush to become membership.most beach front spa area block only for member not a sibgle one for other non member gust

Stayed at the Hacienda at Hard Rock Hotel Riviera Maya. Favorite dinner places were Zen for Hibachi and Toro for steak. I recommend making reservations as soon as you get to the resort as prime times fill up quickly. There were several activities by the pool throughout the day as games and water aquatics lead by Roberto, Eduardo, Rulo, Chema, Braulio and Monse. All very friendly, energetic and service minded.  The last day I had aquatic class with Luna and Iris. The music and energy was great. Outside table for breakfast at Ipanema Grill with Lois and Louis as our servers became tradition every morning. Great service and stunning views.

Great property everything worked. A bit noisy in the late evenings. Lots of activities.  I was able to have sushi, Asian food, a good steak restaurant and breakfast had great choices. Check-in and check-out were easy.  Beach wave was a bit choppy

This was our second time staying at this Hard Rock location and again it was a fabulous trip. Absolutely beautiful beach/ocean. The Hotel, even though it's not new, is very nice and so clean. The staff are were attentive and very friendly. Food was excellent and drinks were great. We will be back again.

My family and I had a great time at the Hard Rock Resort in Cancun Mexico. Thanks to Carlos at Vacation’s Planners for taking care of us and making my family’s stay a memorable one. Carlos went out of his way to assist us with great recommendations and information we needed to make the best decisions for a great getaway.

After we checked in we were seated with a gentlemen, Carlos, who we believed was concierge service. We later found out he was a representative of "Legendary" and selling time share. We agreed to a presentation which was the day after check in and also my wife's birthday. In return Carlos "told us" we were to receive a romantic dinner, which he told us was not available for my wife's birthday. He could offer the dinner for Wednesday night instead. We agreed. Since it was my wife's birthday we decided to do the hibachi dinner which Carlos told us he would make the reservation for in addition to the romantic beach dinner. The evening of my wife's birthday we went to the hibachi only to find out there was no reservation AND we could not eat in the restaurant because there was a

The hotel staff insists on guests buying the timeshare product. Waiting times to get seated on every restaurant exceed 90 minutes. Staff doesn't care about providing solutions to waiting times for dinner. The hotel makes a priority the timeshare owners and put the regular guest at the end of their top of mind. We had to look for outside restaurants, by the way the spirits catalogue consists of the cheapest and lowest quality in the industry . Do no think for one minute that they offer even Bacardi

TERRIBLE!  First off we are HALL OF FAME LEGENDARY MEMBERS! So pay close attention to this review! The only good thing about staying here is that you have a butler, who only helps you in making reservations at the restaurants, reservations at the spa, reservations on the beach in the beds and this would be it. They gave us one of their smallest and worst rooms by far. Our room air conditioning doesn’t work. The water cuts off between two and five in the morning, I asked for them to change our room, and they refused.  Imagine we are Hall of Fame members who have paid near 100 K to have the top membership….. what a load of BS . Do not stay here, do not buy any type of membership here unless you like, giving away your money and being lied to. Butlers are nice but are limited to

Hospitality is amazing. Husband and I always stay here and we can’t say enough good things about them. We love it here. They go out of your way to make sure you’re having a good time. Love the music!!

We had an overall excellent experience at Hard Rock Hotel Cancun. The only area that could be improved is the variety of food, especially in terms of fruits and juices, such as freshly squeezed options.  Super friendly staff and fun environment!

The service was amazing. My butlers Jessy, Alexis and a new guy Jesus were terrific. They genuinely cared how much I enjoyed my vacation. They were very kind to my nieces and looked out for them when I was not present. We sat in our reserved spot on the Oasis everyday and Araceli served us drinks and food promptly and with a gorgeous smile. We especially enjoyed our waiter in Toro Gustavo.Miguel and his staff made wonderful wine choices during our chefs dinner.

Cons: transport was confusing and a waiting game- rather have paid for a taxi, the sales for timeshare was from the checkin and all the way to the checkout non stop - we had a “VIP breakfast” until we figured out it was a sales pitch, HOT inside the hotel - rather stay outside, hotel room was with a view of the rooftop and street, plumbing was an issue - toilet clogged and bathtub took forever to fill, staff called for luggage but never called to set up transport to airport - had to set up morning of Pros: customer service, room cleaning, pool side activities were interesting Main issue was the hotel was HOT everywhere you went, the only place of solace was our room to cool off in :(

Unfortunately the expectation was too high but this place is awful , you only get treated well if you are a member of their legendary program. Food is bad, staff is rude, they say to get good service you must tip at least $20 in advance. Bars close at 5pm, beach service ends at 4pm

I paid a lot of money to be scammed and take advantage of. I am very very disappointed in this hotel. I am a legendary club member and was treated very poorly. This was the worst vacation I have ever had and it is because of Hard Rock Cancún and Legendary vacations. I separate them because they kept blaming the other. However they are owned by the same company. I left in tears out with my family through the front gate on foot. They are all scammers and don’t care about their members after they have your money.

Everything was good. Food was great.  I would have rated it good vs very good due to several misses by the front desk.  It was made very good by some great people who work outside, such as trainee Christopher, who was phenomenal in engaging us in activities and his overall customer Svc skills, attitude and always having a smile on his face.

Hard Rock in a phrase: The most annoying and aggressive marketing ever.  To be fair: - The food is good. - The view to the beach is amazing. - The staff is very respectful and helpful. - The room is well maintained and beautiful. - The butler does an excellent job and is very friendly.  So it was definitely worth it. But it almost wasn't worth it, as we almost didn't cancel  a deal we made on a terrible contract for a hotel vacation club called Legendary that marketers and sellers pressed on us.  This is a short description regarding this completely unnecessary and terrible experience that they added to our vacation:  They will offer a 90 min pitch for you the next morning to hear about their vacation clubs in exchange for a free massage. DO NOT GO. Only someone who was tricked

The hotel was tired and is in need of refurbishment, tiles were falling off in the pool and the air conditioning units were constantly dripping amongst other issues. The staff were friendly and the Hotel was clean however it wasn't the experience that we had 5 years before. The first day of our holiday was also taken up by people trying to get us to buy into more holidays, upgrade and book trips when all we wanted to really do was relax.

Food was terrible, hotel was old and run down, ac in room did not work, mold on walls, hotel smelled funny. Nicest part about it was the beach and pool. Won't be back and definitely don't recommend...

We had a great experience.  Location is small and a little dated but the service was top notch.  Christian and Robert on the entertainment staff were always around and were great fun.  Efrain was great at Zen.  It was our favorite restaurant.  Isla service was good but menu was pretty limited for us.   If you need a pool chair catch Tacho. He was always running and willing to help.  And lastly a big shout out to Principe  he dealt with all my wife’s crazy food request like a champ.   Overall we would highly recommend

It’s expensive and not cost benefit oriented, they try to sell you the membership program they offer, even if you say NO several times. They use confuse messages in order to push the sell of the program. Very abusive, expensive and old. Food, not good enough and very selective between members and non members. You can have benefits at a very HIGH COST, beach beds, amenities and even good liquor.

Wonderful staff and great food.  Facilities are very clean and well maintained.  Freddy “Mercury” at the float pool bar was awesome.  All the staff was very friendly and helpful but had to give a shout out to Freddy for his above the top service and drinks.   We will definitely be staying again.
